722896f.title: Manhattan: Riverside Drive - 86th Street
722896f.text:
Riverside Park: The Soldiers and Sailors Monument
located on Riverside Drive at West 89th Street. Memorial
Day Servies are held tnere annually.
About 1905

722897f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Drive - 86th Street
722897f-a.text:
Riverside Park at West 89th Street, showing the Soldiers and
Sailors Memorial Monument, erected in 1902 to commemorate the valor
of the Union soldiers in the Civil War. Paul Duboy was the sculptor.
About 1910
Gift Of Urbrock Collection

714740f-b.title: Manhattan: 86th Street (West) - Riverside Drive
714740f-b.text:
(1)
West 86th Street, east from Riverside Drive, showing the huga
apartment houses that line this thoroughfare, surplanting the former
4 and 5 story private residences. Note St. Pauls M. E. Church in a
line with the traffic officer.
May 1928.
George L. Balgue.
:rS,2  ENA~5051
1 V M MDJ -
(2)
A viex of No's. 351 and 349 which appear on the extreme left of
No. 1 and still stand at this date.
Aucust 15, 1938.
P. L. Sperr
Ne. ~2300

722893f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Drive - 86th Street
722893f-a.text:
Riverside Park: A set of 2 views in a generally northward direction
from the Soldiers and Sailors Monument on the west side of the Drive at
the head of West 89th Street. Buildings on the right, on the east side
of the Drive, face this marginal park that skirts the North River; View
2 showing this aspect mainly.
June 16, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

722893f-b.title: Manhattan: Riverside Drive - 86th Street
722893f-b.text:
Riverside Park: A set of 2 views in a generally northward direction
from the Soldiers and Sailors Monument on the west side of the Drive at
the head of West 89th Street. Buildings on the right, on the east side
of the Drive, face this marginal park that skirts the North River; View
2 showing this aspect mainly.
June 16, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

722898f.title: Manhattan: Riverside Drive - 86th Street (West)
722898f.text:
Riverside Park, at West 89th Street, showing the
Soldiers and Sailors Monument. It was erected in 1902 to
commemorate the valor of those who died in defense of the
Union during the Civil War. Paul E. Muboy is the sculptor.
It is made of white marble in the form of a small circular
Greek Temple with a peristyle of twelve Corinthian columns.
1936
W.P.A. Photo
Federal Writers Project

722722f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Drive - 86th Street
722722f-a.text:
140 to 147 Riverside Drive, east side, north from W. 88th
to 87th Streets, showing a block fronnt of private residences
(built in 1896 by Henry Cook, architect) that are ahout to be
replaced bya modern 18 story apartment house at a cost of
92,500,000. An account to this effect is in the New York Times
of Aummmt 7, 1938. Included in this plan are 4 additional
dwellings, No. 351 W. 86th Street (rirht of No. 1) and No's.
348,50 and 52 N. 87th Street (not seen) Dr. John A. Harriss,
forrer denartrent commissioner of police,occupied for years
Io. 140, the structure at the N.W. corner of W. 85th Street.
No.2 is a southward view from a point slihtlv to the north
of W. 87th Street.
Aumst 15, 1938.
Views 1 and 2
P.L. Sperr

722894f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Drive - 86th Street
722894f-a.text:
Riverside Park: The Soldiers ano Sailors Monument,
located on Riverside Drive at West 89th Street.
Memorial Day servies are held here annually.
August 15, 1938

722723f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Drive - 86th Street
722723f-a.text:
Riverside Drive, east side, from 86th to but not including 87th Streets.
About 1904.
Brown Brothers.
